body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14942](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14942.html) (wallet: Make scan / abort status private to CWallet by Empact)
* [#13756](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/13756.html) (wallet: "avoid_reuse" wallet flag for improved privacy by kallewoof)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Thanks @meshcollider, updated.
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15730/commits/3ae04b283453b669bcb0809380e973aa7e7adac0

Nice addition!
Concept ACK
Needs rebase, I think this is ready
@MarcoFalke rebased.
utACK c8664bb0c76f0c6a1eedaa253a03640b5dba7d38
Rebased due to #15901.

Partial tACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15730/commits/008896693c0336b27d54833939fc9c65b544a362 using testnet. The explicitness of `"scanning": false` seems to me an improvement over returning null when no rescan is in progress. Interesting that no tests need be updated and might be good to add coverage in this PR or a follow-up. I've written functional test coverage for this as an exercise but am unsure if coverage like this is welcome given the Travis CI timeouts.

Output before/after rescan, and during:
```
  "private_keys_enabled": true,
  "scanning": false
}
```
```
  "private_keys_enabled": true,
  "scanning": {
    "duration": 35,
    "progress": 0.04219915475488047
  }
}
```

Currently testing...
Is it intended to output the progress as scientific notation representation?
Mainnet Example:
```
"scanning": {
    "duration": 2,
    "progress": 8.107329471549215e-07
  }
```

Would it make sense to round it to a certain precision level?
@jonasschnelli That would absolutely make sense from a usability perspective -- we should do that :-)
Nah, JSON-RPC is intended for software, not humans.

@jonasschnelli I'm not seeing that notation on Linux Debian with mainnet and testnet, is it perhaps implementation-dependent?

There was a discussion about precision above: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15730#discussion_r275852684

Oh. I missed that comment.
Yeah, @MarcoFalke is right, we use the same in `getblockchaininfo` `verificationprogress` which is (in both cases) a `double` converted to the JSON internal string with `std::setprecision(16)`

> @jonasschnelli IIUC progress rshould return a value between 0 and 1?

What do you mean with that?
8.107329471549215e-07 is between 0 and 1 (its ~== 0.000000810732947).
[Quod erat demonstrandum](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15730#issuecomment-488601434) 😁

> > @jonasschnelli IIUC progress rshould return a value between 0 and 1?
> 
> What do you mean with that?
> 8.107329471549215e-07 is between 0 and 1 (its ~== 0.000000810732947).

Right. Never mind :)
Sorry for the force push, had to fix @luke-jr comment https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15730#discussion_r280365879. No changes since 0088966, should be easy to re-ACK.

diff_hunk:
@@ -2406,6 +2406,9 @@ static UniValue getwalletinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)

             "  \"hdseedid\": \"<hash160>\"            (string, optional) the Hash160 of the HD seed (only present when HD is enabled)\n"
             "  \"private_keys_enabled\": true|false (boolean) false if privatekeys are disabled for this wallet (enforced watch-only wallet)\n"
+            "  \"scannning_active\": true|false     (boolean) whether the local blockchain is being scanned for wallet related transactions\n"
+            "  \"scanning_duration\": true|false   (numeric) scanning duration in milliseconds\n"
body: not boolean..

diff_hunk:
@@ -2406,6 +2406,11 @@ static UniValue getwalletinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,                (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
             "  \"hdseedid\": \"<hash160>\"            (string, optional) the Hash160 of the HD seed (only present when HD is enabled)\n"
             "  \"private_keys_enabled\": true|false (boolean) false if privatekeys are disabled for this wallet (enforced watch-only wallet)\n"
+            "  \"scanning\":                        (json object) current scanning details, or null if no scan is in progress\n"
+            "    {\n"
+            "      \"duration\" : xxxx              (numeric) elapsed milliseconds since scan start\n"
body: Changed to seconds, only integral part.
shouldn't this (in theory) lock `mutexScanning` to avoid the risk of an out-of-sync `fScanningWallet`/`m_scanning_start` combination (same for line below and wallet.cpp:L1795)?

```suggestion
        obj.pushKV("scanning", UniValue());
```

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/master/contrib/devtools#clang-format-diffpy

`m_scanning_start` is constant right before `fScanningWallet` is set to `true` so in this case I don't think it's necessary.

The atomic `m_scanning_progress` is only read when `fScanningWallet` is `true`. Also, `m_scanning_progress` is only changed in `ScanForWalletTransactions`, and we ensure there's only one scan in progress.
Fixed.

diff_hunk:
@@ -2406,6 +2406,11 @@ static UniValue getwalletinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,                (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
             "  \"hdseedid\": \"<hash160>\"            (string, optional) the Hash160 of the HD seed (only present when HD is enabled)\n"
             "  \"private_keys_enabled\": true|false (boolean) false if privatekeys are disabled for this wallet (enforced watch-only wallet)\n"
+            "  \"scanning\":                        (json objects) current scanning details, or null if no scan is in progress\n"
+            "    {\n"
+            "      \"duration\" : xxxx              (numeric) elapsed seconds since scan start\n"
+            "      \"progress\" : x.xxxx,           (numeric) scanning progress percentage [0.0, 1.0]\n"
+            "    }\n"
             "}\n"
body:
Nice! Am indeed seeing (in testnet):
```
"scanning": {
    "duration": 168,
    "progress": 0.265890921329112
  }
```
However, after running `abortrescan`, this is output:
```
"scanning": null
```
Is this the desired behavior?

Note that in these 2 cases, the field is absent. EDIT: No scanning key returned in those cases during my manual testnet testing.
- before rescanblockchain
- after abortrescan, stopping, and restarting bitcoind

body:
> Is this the desired behavior?

Yes, this was suggested by @MarcoFalke. `scanning` key is also present right?

BTW, `"progress": 0.265890921329112` maybe should limit precision?

Are you sure you are running the right binary? All code paths should push back a "scanning" key?

             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,                (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"

+            "    }\n"
             "}\n"
body:
> Are you sure you are running the right binary? All code paths should push back a "scanning" key?

Argh, you are right about the binary. Now seeing `"scanning": null` in the cases above. Makes sense given `src/wallet/rpcwallet.cpp:2458`. Apologies.
Seems better to just omit it?
Yeah I could do that.

diff_hunk:
@@ -2406,6 +2406,11 @@ static UniValue getwalletinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,                (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
             "  \"hdseedid\": \"<hash160>\"            (string, optional) the Hash160 of the HD seed (only present when HD is enabled)\n"
             "  \"private_keys_enabled\": true|false (boolean) false if privatekeys are disabled for this wallet (enforced watch-only wallet)\n"
+            "  \"scanning\":                        (json objects) current scanning details, or null if no scan is in progress\n"
body: Just one object, right?

diff_hunk:
@@ -2406,6 +2406,11 @@ static UniValue getwalletinfo(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,                (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
             "  \"hdseedid\": \"<hash160>\"            (string, optional) the Hash160 of the HD seed (only present when HD is enabled)\n"
             "  \"private_keys_enabled\": true|false (boolean) false if privatekeys are disabled for this wallet (enforced watch-only wallet)\n"
+            "  \"scanning\":                        (json objects) current scanning details, or null if no scan is in progress\n"
body: Right!
Then the result would look the same as in the previous version and you couldn't tell (without looking at the bitcoin core version) whether a rescan is happening or not.
Yeap, that's true if the client is human.
IIRC `null` is the same as omitted in JSON-RPC, so maybe in that case we should put `false` here?

yeah, the value is omitted, but not the key.

Though, I am also fine with "false", maybe it is more clear even
Changed `null` to `false`.
Semicolon is still missing from this commit.
Thanks, bad fixup :/

diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+RPC changes
+-----------
+The RPC `getwalletinfo` response now includes the `scanning` key with an object
+if there is a scanning in progress or `false` otherwise. Currently the object
body: s/scanning/scan/
Perhaps divide by 1000 in src/wallet/wallet.h:L825 instead of here?
The noun is "scan", so it could be shorter to name these `ScanDuration` and `ScanProgress`.

diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@
+RPC changes
+-----------
+The RPC `getwalletinfo` response now includes the `scanning` key with an object
+if there is a scanning in progress or `false` otherwise. Currently the object
body: better yet: "if a scan is in progress,"
